result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $2000.00

9:46 AM Defendant Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad not in court.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts. 
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 
Court issues a Branch 2 Only Capias and revokes and forfeits bond.

Branch 2 Only
Ext. Code: 3
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:45 AM Attorney Daniel P Repka in court.   Defendant Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Repka states that his client was arrested last night in Minneapolis, Minnesota and states the Defendant has around 25 case open in Minnesota and requests to adjourn the matter. 
The Court questions if the Defendant can appear from video.
Attorney Repka states he is unsure. 
The Court excuses the Defendant's appearance today due to the circumstances.
The Court will adjourn the matter to see what happens with the Defendant's cases in Minnesota and if he can appear via Zoom.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM IF THE DEFENDANT IS STILL IN CUSTODY.  IF THE DEFENDANT IS OUT OF CUSTODY, THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR IN PERSON.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

to the Court filed by Atty. Daniel Repka requesting to appear by Zoom for 6/29 hearing.

Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:36 AM Defendant Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad appeared by Zoom with attorney Daniel P Repka who appeared by Zoom.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Attorney Repka requests to extend the deadline for filing motions.
The Court grants the request and extends the deadline 30 days passed receiving discovery in the matter.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty Anna Kees
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:46 AM Defendant Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad appeared by Zoom with attorney Daniel P Repka who appeared by Zoom.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Attorney Repka anticipates the preliminary hearing to be a waiver but would like to set this matter for a preliminary.  The Court will schedule this matter for a preliminary hearing.  Time limits were previously waived.  So long as a waiver is filed at least 48 hours ahead of time, the Court will allow for the parties to appear by Zoom.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Hearing on March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:49 AM Defendant Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court addresses the fact that the defendant does not have counsel and has not signed his bond.  The defendant indicates he signed the bond and faxed it back in to the Criminal Division.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The warrant shall remain until the bond is signed.  If the defendant has not signed his bond by the next date, the Court will convert the bond to a cash bond.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant failed to sign signature bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing of the $2,000.00 signature bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released.
Hearing on March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Target/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.    Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

10:32 AM Defendant Abdulrhman Ali Gele Kayad appeared by Zoom.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to seek counsel.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM.  Check Case scheduled for March 4, 2022.  Hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
